doc_desc.title: World Health Organization Disability Assessment Schedule 2.0 (WHODAS 2.0) - Functional Disability

title_statement.title: World Health Organization Disability Assessment Schedule 2.0 (WHODAS 2.0) - Functional Disability

study_info.abstract: The WHODAS 2.0 is a 12-item measure assessing difficulties in daily functioning due to physical or mental health problems. Items cover domains like cognition, mobility, self-care, and social participation. Rated on a 5-point scale, it provides a profile of functional disability across key life areas.

instrument_details.validity: Good correlation with clinical outcome measures

questions.question_text: In the past 30 days, how much difficulty did you have in concentrating or remembering things?
In the past 30 days, how much difficulty did you have in walking or climbing stairs?
In the past 30 days, how much difficulty did you have in washing your whole body?
In the past 30 days, how much difficulty did you have in getting dressed?
In the past 30 days, how much difficulty did you have in dealing with people you do not know?
In the past 30 days, how much difficulty did you have in maintaining a friendship?
In the past 30 days, how much difficulty did you have in your day-to-day work or school?
In the past 30 days, how much difficulty did you have in household responsibilities?
In the past 30 days, how much difficulty did you have in participating in community activities?
In the past 30 days, how much difficulty did you have due to barriers or prejudice?
In the past 30 days, how much time did you spend on your health problem or its consequences?
In the past 30 days, how much difficulty did you have in doing things by yourself for relaxation or pleasure?
